abstract: India has achieved reasonable success in fighting poverty, Manu Joseph writes.
snippet: India has achieved reasonable success in fighting poverty, Manu Joseph writes.
lead_paragraph: "Indians are less gullible now. They have far greater expectations from the government, and the state has more money to spend on them," Manu Joseph writes in The New York Times today. But that doesn't mean that anyone has figured out how, exactly, to fight poverty. Read more »

headline.main: New Cures for an Old Problem
